poems.title: Another Day
poems.body:
I open my eyes
another day, but it’s the same.

The movements a blueprint
of the day before.

I smile, I’m alive.

I sit on the edge of the bed,
and wait
for the part where it feels different.

Nothing happens.

I step outside, cold air
winter sting.

Bare bark illuminated
by the morning sun over the horizon.

The neighborhood children wait on the corner.

A bus comes.

The garage closes.

I drive away.
